member.name: T:System.Net.ServicePointManager
member.summary: Manages the collection of objects.

member.name: P:System.Net.ServicePointManager.CheckCertificateRevocationList
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the certificate is checked against the certificate authority revocation list.
member.returns: if the certificate revocation list is checked; otherwise, .

member.name: P:System.Net.ServicePointManager.DefaultConnectionLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of concurrent connections allowed by a object.
member.returns: The maximum number of concurrent connections allowed by a object. The default value is 2. When an app is running as an ASP.NET host, it is not possible to alter the value of this property through the config file if the autoConfig property is set to . However, you can change the value programmatically when the autoConfig property is . Set your preferred value once, when the AppDomain loads.
member.exception: is less than or equal to 0.

member.name: F:System.Net.ServicePointManager.DefaultNonPersistentConnectionLimit
member.summary: The default number of non-persistent connections (4) allowed on a object connected to an HTTP/1.0 or later server. This field is constant but is no longer used in the .NET Framework 2.0.

member.name: F:System.Net.ServicePointManager.DefaultPersistentConnectionLimit
member.summary: The default number of persistent connections (2) allowed on a object connected to an HTTP/1.1 or later server. This field is constant and is used to initialize the property if the value of the property has not been set either directly or through configuration.

member.name: P:System.Net.ServicePointManager.DnsRefreshTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates how long a Domain Name Service (DNS) resolution is considered valid.
member.returns: The time-out value, in milliseconds. A value of -1 indicates an infinite time-out period. The default value is 120,000 milliseconds (two minutes).

member.name: P:System.Net.ServicePointManager.EnableDnsRoundRobin
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a Domain Name Service (DNS) resolution rotates among the applicable Internet Protocol (IP) addresses.
member.returns: if a DNS resolution always returns the first IP address for a particular host; otherwise . The default is .

member.name: P:System.Net.ServicePointManager.EncryptionPolicy
member.summary: Gets the for this instance.
member.returns: The encryption policy to use for this instance.

member.name: P:System.Net.ServicePointManager.Expect100Continue
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether 100-Continue behavior is used.
member.returns: to enable 100-Continue behavior. The default value is .

member.name: M:System.Net.ServicePointManager.FindServicePoint(System.Uri,System.Net.IWebProxy)
member.summary: Finds an existing object or creates a new object to manage communications with the specified object.
member.param: A object that contains the address of the Internet resource to contact.
The proxy data for this request.
member.returns: The object that manages communications for the request.
member.exception: The maximum number of objects defined in has been reached.

member.exception: The maximum number of objects defined in has been reached.

The proxy data for this request.

The maximum number of objects defined in has been reached.

member.name: P:System.Net.ServicePointManager.MaxServicePointIdleTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum idle time of a object.
member.returns: The maximum idle time, in milliseconds, of a object. The default value is 100,000 milliseconds (100 seconds).
member.exception: is less than or greater than .

member.name: P:System.Net.ServicePointManager.MaxServicePoints
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of objects to maintain at any time.
member.returns: The maximum number of objects to maintain. The default value is 0, which means there is no limit to the number of objects.
member.exception: is less than 0 or greater than .

member.name: P:System.Net.ServicePointManager.ReusePort
member.summary: Setting this property value to causes all outbound TCP connections from HttpWebRequest to use the native socket option SO_REUSE_UNICASTPORT on the socket. This causes the underlying outgoing ports to be shared. This is useful for scenarios where a large number of outgoing connections are made in a short time, and the app risks running out of ports.
member.returns: Returns .

member.name: P:System.Net.ServicePointManager.SecurityProtocol
member.summary: Gets or sets the security protocol used by the objects managed by the object.
member.returns: One of the values defined in the enumeration.
member.exception: The value specified to set the property is not a valid enumeration value.

member.name: P:System.Net.ServicePointManager.ServerCertificateValidationCallback
member.summary: Gets or sets the callback to validate a server certificate.
member.returns: A . The default value is .

member.name: M:System.Net.ServicePointManager.SetTcpKeepAlive(System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Enables or disables the keep-alive option on a TCP connection.
member.param: If set to true, then the TCP keep-alive option on a TCP connection will be enabled using the specified keepAliveTime and keepAliveInterval values. If set to false, then the TCP keep-alive option is disabled and the remaining parameters are ignored. The default value is false.
Specifies the timeout, in milliseconds, with no activity until the first keep-alive packet is sent. The value must be greater than 0. If a value of less than or equal to zero is passed an is thrown.

Specifies the interval, in milliseconds, between when successive keep-alive packets are sent if no acknowledgement is received. The value must be greater than 0. If a value of less than or equal to zero is passed an is thrown.
member.exception: The value specified for keepAliveTime or keepAliveInterval parameter is less than or equal to 0.

member.name: P:System.Net.ServicePointManager.UseNagleAlgorithm
member.summary: Determines whether the Nagle algorithm is used by the service points managed by this object.
member.returns: to use the Nagle algorithm; otherwise, . The default value is .

member.name: T:System.Net.ServicePoint
member.summary: Provides connection management for HTTP connections.

member.name: P:System.Net.ServicePoint.Address
member.summary: Gets the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) of the server that this object connects to.
member.returns: An instance of the class that contains the URI of the Internet server that this object connects to.

member.name: P:System.Net.ServicePoint.BindIPEndPointDelegate
member.summary: Specifies the delegate to associate a local with a .
member.returns: A delegate that forces a to use a particular local Internet Protocol (IP) address and port number. The default value is .

member.name: P:System.Net.ServicePoint.Certificate

member.name: P:System.Net.ServicePoint.ClientCertificate

member.name: M:System.Net.ServicePoint.CloseConnectionGroup(System.String)
member.summary: Removes the specified connection group from this object.
member.param: The name of the connection group that contains the connections to close and remove from this service point.
member.returns: A value that indicates whether the connection group was closed.

member.name: P:System.Net.ServicePoint.ConnectionLeaseTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of milliseconds after which an active connection is closed.
member.returns: A that specifies the number of milliseconds that an active connection remains open. The default is -1, which allows an active connection to stay connected indefinitely. Set this property to 0 to force connections to close after servicing a request.
member.exception: The value specified for a set operation is a negative number less than -1.

member.name: P:System.Net.ServicePoint.ConnectionLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of connections allowed on this object.
member.returns: The maximum number of connections allowed on this object.
member.exception: The connection limit is equal to or less than 0.

member.name: P:System.Net.ServicePoint.ConnectionName
member.summary: Gets the connection name.

member.name: P:System.Net.ServicePoint.CurrentConnections

member.name: P:System.Net.ServicePoint.Expect100Continue
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether 100-Continue behavior is used.
member.returns: to expect 100-Continue responses for requests; otherwise, . The default value is .

member.name: P:System.Net.ServicePoint.IdleSince
member.summary: Gets the date and time that the object was last connected to a host.

member.name: P:System.Net.ServicePoint.MaxIdleTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of time a connection associated with the object can remain idle before the connection is closed.
member.returns: The length of time, in milliseconds, that a connection associated with the object can remain idle before it is closed and reused for another connection.

member.name: M:System.Net.ServicePoint.SetTcpKeepAlive(System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Enables or disables the keep-alive option on a TCP connection.
member.param: If set to true, then the TCP keep-alive option on a TCP connection will be enabled using the specified keepAliveTime and keepAliveInterval values. If set to false, then the TCP keep-alive option is disabled and the remaining parameters are ignored. The default value is false.
Specifies the timeout, in milliseconds, with no activity until the first keep-alive packet is sent. The value must be greater than 0. If a value of less than or equal to zero is passed an is thrown.

Specifies the interval, in milliseconds, between when successive keep-alive packets are sent if no acknowledgement is received. The value must be greater than 0. If a value of less than or equal to zero is passed an is thrown.
member.exception: The value specified for keepAliveTime or keepAliveInterval parameter is less than or equal to 0.

member.name: T:System.Net.SecurityProtocolType
member.summary: Specifies the security protocols that are supported by the Schannel security package.

member.name: F:System.Net.SecurityProtocolType.Ssl3
member.summary: Specifies the Secure Socket Layer (SSL) 3.0 security protocol.

member.name: F:System.Net.SecurityProtocolType.SystemDefault
member.summary: Allows the operating system to choose the best protocol to use, and to block protocols that are not secure. Unless your app has a specific reason not to, you should use this value.

member.name: F:System.Net.SecurityProtocolType.Tls
member.summary: Specifies the Transport Layer Security (TLS) 1.0 security protocol.

member.name: F:System.Net.SecurityProtocolType.Tls11
member.summary: Specifies the Transport Layer Security (TLS) 1.1 security protocol.

member.name: F:System.Net.SecurityProtocolType.Tls12
member.summary: Specifies the Transport Layer Security (TLS) 1.2 security protocol.
